Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Platter \Plat"ter\, n. [From {Plat} to braid.] One who plats or braids. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Platter \Plat"ter\, n. [Probably fr. OF. platel, F. plateau. See {Plateau}.] A large plate or shallow dish on which meat or other food is brought to the table. [1913 Webster]
The attendants . . . speedly brought in several large, smoking platters, filled with huge pieces of beef. --Sir W. Scott. [1913 Webster]

platter n 1: a large shallow dish used for serving food 2: sound recording consisting of a disc with continuous grooves; formerly used to reproduce music by rotating while a phonograph needle tracked in the grooves [syn: {phonograph record}, {phonograph recording}, {record}, {disk}, {disc}]
